alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Pike; Spencer; Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 29 at 8:56AM EDT until June 29 at 9:45AM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: The National Weather Service in Paducah has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Warrick County in southwestern Indiana... Spencer County in southwestern Indiana... Eastern Gibson County in southwestern Indiana... Southeastern Pike County in southwestern Indiana... * Until 845 AM CDT/945 AM EDT/. * At 756 AM CDT/856 AM EDT/, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles north of Folsomville, or 12 miles southeast of Oakland City, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Public reported ping-pong ball size hail. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Boonville, Dale, Lynnville, Grandview, Santa Claus, Folsomville, Chrisney, Tennyson, Gentryville and Spurgeon. This includes Interstate 64 in Indiana between Mile Markers 36 and 60. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
